--- In archive-crawle=
r@yahoogroups.com, Michael Stack <stack@...> wrote:
>
> Doug Judd of Zvents=
 has contributed an HDFS Writer Processor.  This 
> processor writes crawle=
d content directly to a Hadoop Distributed File 
> System (HDFS) as Hadoop =
SequenceFiles rather than as Internet Archive 
> ARCs to local disk. The Se=
quenceFiles are made up of records keyed by 
> URL whose value is a compoun=
d of crawled page content, request headers, 
> response header, and crawl m=
etadata.  To learn more about this new 
> addition, see Doug's README: http=
://www.zvents.com/hdfs/README.txt 
> <http://www.zvents.com/hdfs/README.txt=
>.  To download visit 
> http://www.zvents.com/labs/hdfs_writer_processor 
=
> <http://www.zvents.com/labs/hdfs_writer_processor> (For more on the 
> Ha=
doop platform, see http://lucene.apache.org/hadoop 
> <http://lucene.apache=
.org/hadoop>).
> 
> St.Ack
>
